No. An unfortunate oversight, Doctor. It won't occur again.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barnes lets fly an energy bolt which the Doctor and Sarah avoid. The Doctor uses a stone to absorb the other ones.

Dialogue.Line: Quickly, Doctor, this way.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Sarah run up the stairs. Tommy gets zapped, but not knocked out. He follows them.
Tommy locks the door.

Dialogue.Line: But, but what about Mike and Cho-Je?
Oh, they'll be out for quite a time. But as long as they're unconscious, they're quite safe.
What happened to the others?
Oh, they've been taken over.
By the spiders?
Yes.
We'd better get out of here.
But, Tommy, you're normal. You're just like everybody else.
I sincerely hope not.
This way.
Where are you taking us?
To the Abbot.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Inside, the Abbot sits meditating in an armchair.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor. Doctor, the crystal.
Yes, yes, Sarah. All in good time.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tommy knocks on the door.

Dialogue.Line: Come in.
This is the Doctor, K'Anpo. K'ANPO: I know. You are welcome.
My friend, Sarah Jane Smith. K'ANPO: It is kind of you to come and visit an old man.
(Tibetan.) K'ANPO: You speak Tibetan?
A little, sir, yes.
What did you just say?

I apologised to the Rinpoche for not bringing him a cotton scarf. K'ANPO: You friend knows not only our language but also our customs. The ceremonial gift merely symbolises friendship. We have no need for symbols, you and I.
I think I'd better keep a watch outside. If the others get out of the cellar K'ANPO: As yet they haven't managed it. They may soon, though. Thank you, Tommy.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tommy leaves.

Dialogue.Line: Pray be seated.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor sits on a stool at the Abbot's feet. Sarah is further away.

Dialogue.Line: Now, Doctor. You have a story to tell me.
Yes, well, I have a strange feeling that you already know most of it. You see, I found a crystal. A blue crystal. K'ANPO: Found?
Well, perhaps stole might be a better word. Forgive me. Have we met before? K'ANPO: The recognition of friends is not always easy. Tell me about this crystal you stole.
Well it didn't occur to me that I had stolen it, at the time. You see

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barnes and Co have crowbarred their way out of the cellar and up the stairs.

Dialogue.Line: We must separate. We must search. He can't have gone far.
No, no, I don't want anything more to do with it. I'm going.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: But the spider on his back has other ideas. He stiffens in pain.

Dialogue.Line: You will stay. You will do as I wish. You will obey me.
Yes, yes, anything. Stop it. Stop it!
What are we supposed to do?
I can see. I can see a blue crystal. LAND'S SPIDER [OC]: Yes, we must find the crystal at any cost. Concentrate. All concentrate.
I can see it too.
It, it's that way. MOSS' SPIDER [OC]: Yes! Yes, we can feel the vibrations. It is near.
Come on then!
So you see, the crystal was even more important than I thought. They want it very badly. K'ANPO: Then perhaps they should have it.
No, sir, never. Once they get a hold of that crystal, nothing can stop them taking over the Earth.
Or even the universe itself.
Or even the universe itself. I wish I knew where that crystal was at this moment.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: K'Anpo takes it from his robe.

Dialogue.Line: Tommy brought it to me. It was the crystal which cured him.
Thank heavens it's safe.
Give it to me.
Sarah, what's the matter with you?
Give
Me the crystal. I must have it. I must! Give it to me!
Sarah, what's come over you? (Sarah zaps the Doctor with energy and he clutches his chest.) K'ANPO: Stay!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sarah stands still.

Dialogue.Line: Sarah, what has the Queen Spider done to you? What has she done? K'ANPO: It's no use. See through my eyes. Look.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: K'Anpo puts his hand on the Doctor's, and the Queen Spider becomes visible on Sarah's back.

Dialogue.Line: Good grief.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tommy is standing guard.

Dialogue.Line: The crystal is in that room.
Get out of the way.
You can't go in there.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Barnes backs away.

Dialogue.Line: What are we going to do?
Be quiet. Stand back, you.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tommy stands firm, so Barnes zaps him. Tommy staggers but stays upright.

Dialogue.Line: Keaver, Land, get him out of the way.
Come on now, Tommy.
Now!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Keaver and Land grab Tommy's arms, but he throws them off. Barnes lunges for him and Tommy twists his arm behind his back.

Dialogue.Line: No, no!
I'm sorry, Mister Barnes.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Tommy kicks Barnes back across the landing.

Dialogue.Line: Kill him!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: All four men zap Tommy.

Dialogue.Line: Sarah, listen to me. Struggle against the spider, Sarah. Fight it!
I am the Queen. K'ANPO: No. You are Sarah Jane Smith.
I, I K'ANPO: You are free. You don't have to be dominated. Look into your mind and see that you are free.
Sarah, look at the crystal. Look at it! Look deep into its blue light.
No! No! I will not. K'ANPO: See that you are free, now.
I am the Queen.
No, I'm free. Free.
The Queen must live. Help me. I shall die.
I'm frightened!
Concentrate, Sarah! Concentrate! K'ANPO: You are free!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: With a cry, the Queen falls from Sarah's back.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Lying on her back, the Queen Spider's legs curl up and she vanishes.
Tommy continues to withstand the energy onslaught.

Dialogue.Line: Wait. We're not getting anywhere. BARNES' SPIDER [OC]: I agree. MOSS'S SPIDER 3 [OC]: And I. LAND'S SPIDER [OC]: And I. BARNES' SPIDER [OC]: We need more power. Concentrate! Concentrate!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The four men stand in a circle, with their fingers touching.

Dialogue.Line: Om. Om. Om. Om. Om. Om. Om.
I'm sorry. I'm so sorry, Doctor.
What have you got to be sorry about? You did very well. You should be proud of yourself.
To let that creature take me over like that. I mean, I actually volunteered. K'ANPO: We are all apt to surrender ourselves to domination. Even the strongest of us.
Do you mean me? K'ANPO: Not all spiders sit on the back.
Oh, I don't understand. You're not saying they've taken over the Doctor, are you?
Oh no, Sarah, no. No, he's talking about my greed.
Greed? You?

Yes, my greed for knowledge, for information. He's saying that all this is basically my fault. If I hadn't taken the crystal in the first place. I know who you are now. K'ANPO: You were always a little slow on the uptake, my boy.
It's been a long, long time.
You know each other?
Oh, yes. Yes, he was my teacher. My, my guru, if you like. In another time, another place. K'ANPO: Another life.
Oh, no. Don't tell me you're a Time Lord too? K'ANPO: I am. But the discipline they serve was not for me.
No. Nor for me. K'ANPO: I wouldn't have chosen your alternative. To borrow a Tardis was a little naughty, to say the least.
Yes, well, I had to get away. I hadn't your power. K'ANPO: Indeed. I regenerated and came to Earth, to Tibet.
Regenerated?
Yes. Yes, when a Time Lord's body wears out, he regenerates, becomes new. K'ANPO: That is why we can live such a long time.
I see. Well, what about Cho-Je? Is he a Time Lord, too? K'ANPO: In a sense. In another sense, he doesn't exist.
You've lost me.
Me too, I'm afraid. K'ANPO: Cho-Je is a projection of my own self.
Mister Yates. Mister Yates.
Where am I? Oh, that spider. CHO-JE: There's not a moment to lose. Come. Come.
Om. Om. Om. Om.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Spiders are humming.

Dialogue.Line: What's going on?
We are sending power to our sisters on Earth.
But what about that crystal?
Be silent!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: K'Anpo has his eyes shut.

Dialogue.Line: What's he doing?
Shush. K'ANPO: As I thought. The moment approaches.
What moment? K'ANPO: The moment I have been waiting for. The moment of truth, if you'll forgive a cliche. The moment of truth for us both. You know what you have to do?
No, I K'ANPO: I think you do, my son. What is it you most fear?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor remembers.

Dialogue.Line: Is that fear I can feel in your mind? You are not accustomed to feeling frightened, are you, Doctor? You are very wise to be afraid of me.
Is there no other way? K'ANPO: None.
Very well. Give me the crystal.
What are you going to do?
Take the crystal to the Great One.
But you told me that if you went back there, the cave of crystal would destroy you.
Nevertheless, I have to go.
Om. Om. Om. Om.
Enough.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They line up again in front of Tommy.

Dialogue.Line: Now!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: This time the energy makes Tommy stagger back against the door.

Dialogue.Line: Take my hand. Quickly!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor takes K'Anpo's hand.

Dialogue.Line: No!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Mike runs in front of Tommy and gets zapped. He falls.

Dialogue.Line: Yates! Mister Yates!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Keaver hits Tommy as the four rush past.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: K'Anpo blocks the men's way.

Dialogue.Line: The crystal. There it is!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor vanishes. Barnes zaps K'Anpo who staggers and slumps back into his chair.

Dialogue.Line: Where's he gone?
Back to the cellar.
Come on!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Downstairs, the Doctor appears on the mandala. He looks around, then runs into the Tardis and it dematerialises.
The Tardis materialises and the Doctor steps out.

Dialogue.Line: Welcome, Doctor.
Arak. Tuar. Your attack was a success, then?
You can see for yourself.
Thanks to you, Doctor.
Look, I need your help. I want to go into the mountain, into the cave of crystal.
You will die.
Well, nevertheless I have to go. Will you show me the way?
There's more than one way into the caves. Come.
I think he's dead. CHO-JE: Not quite. Carry him to K'Anpo Rinpoche.
So, you lied. Your attack failed.
Did you really believe these creatures could overcome the eight legs? They have minds as easily controlled as their own sheep. Why have you come back?
To return the crystal.
You have the crystal? Here?
Yes. Yes, of course.
Give it to me.
No. I shall return the crystal only to the Great One herself.
All praise to the Great One!
Is there any among you would dare take it from me?
I would dare.
Stop, Lupton!
Why do you stop me? Everything we've planned, everything we've dreamed of is there in the palm of his hand.
We dare not take the crystal. The Great One is all seeing.
All praise to the Great One!
The Great One is all knowing.
All praise to the Great One!
The Great One is all powerful!
All praise to the Great One!
You have beaten us, Doctor. It is good that you will die.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Arak and Tuar reluctantly let the Doctor leave.

Dialogue.Line: You superstitious fools.
Be silent, Lupton!
I will not be silent. I've listened to you for too long. To think that I've lost my chance of power through a spider! A spider that I could crush underfoot, without a second thought. A spider!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Lupton raises his fist to hit the Queen, so she zaps him.

Dialogue.Line: His compassion protected him, just as Tommy's innocence was his shield.
Hello, Sarah Jane.
Hi. Hey, we thought you'd had it.
Well, not this time. Oh, I feel fine.
Yeah?
K'Anpo.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: K'Anpo looks very tired.

Dialogue.Line: I'm afraid this old body has had it, Miss Smith.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: K'Anpo's head falls back.

Dialogue.Line: No! CHO-JE: Dear friends, please don't. Please don't

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cho-Je vanishes.

Dialogue.Line: What's happening?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: K'Anpo becomes Cho-Je.

Dialogue.Line: Please don't. Please don't concern yourselves. I am not dying, merely regenerating.
Cho-Je. CHO-JE: No, Tommy. I am K'Anpo. Will you put this in your magazine, Sarah Jane Smith?
Stop! Have you brought the crystal to me?
Well if I had not, why should I have returned?
Very well. Very well, advance.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor walks around a corner and sees the universes biggest spider.

Dialogue.Line: I've brought you the crystal. Now why don't you just take it and leave the humans in peace, both here and on Earth?
You think I care for the puny plans of my subjects? Earth? One paltry planet among millions? Give me the crystal. I thirst for it! I ache for it!
Well, why is it so important to you?
You see this web of crystal above my head? It reproduces the pattern of my brain. One perfect crystal and it will be complete. That is the perfect crystal I need.
And then?
My every thought will resonate within the web, and grow in power until, until, until
But you've built a positive feedback circuit. You're trying to increase your mental powers to infinity.
Exactly! I shall be the ruler of the entire universe!

Now listen to me. Listen. I haven't got much time left. What you're trying to do is impossible. If you complete that circuit, the energy will build up and up until it cannot be contained. You will destroy yourself.

You waste the little time remaining to you. Even now the cave of crystal is destroying the cells of your body. I will grant you one last favour. You may watch the completion of my triumph before you die!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The crystal flies out of the Doctor's hand and becomes the keystone of the web lattice.

Dialogue.Line: I am complete! Now I am total power! All praise to the Great One!
Stop. Stop! Don't you see what's happened to you?
All praise to the Great One! All praise to me! Bow down before me, planets! Bow down, stars! Bow down, all galaxies and worship the Great One! The me! The Great, all-powerful me! Argh!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The giant spider starts to glow red.

Dialogue.Line: I hurt! Help me! I am burning! My brain is on fire!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor runs out of the cave.

Dialogue.Line: Help me!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The spiders are dying here too.

Dialogue.Line: The influence is going.
We're free!
Come, my brother.
Om. Om. Om.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The spiders die and fall of the men's backs. The Doctor staggers back to the Tardis and goes inside before the crystal mountain explodes.

Dialogue.Line: Hello, Miss Smith.
Oh, hello, Brigadier. I just thought I'd pop in and. Well, to tell you the truth, I don't quite know why I did pop in, actually.
To see if there was any sign of the old fellow, eh?
Yes. But there can't be, can there? I mean, he's been gone over three weeks now.
Oh, that's nothing. One time I didn't see him for months. And what's more, when he did turn up, he had a new face. Could have been a completely different man.
No. he knew if he went back there he would destroy himself. We'll never see him again.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Tardis materialises and the Doctor almost falls out of the doorway.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor!
Hello, Sarah. I got lost in the time vortex. The Tardis brought me home.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor steps out of the Tardis and falls onto the floor. The Brigadier puts a cushion under his head.

Dialogue.Line: Oh! Oh, Doctor, why did you have to go back?
I had to face my fear, Sarah. I had to face my fear. That was more important than just going on living.
Please, don't die.
A tear, Sarah Jane? No, don't cry. While there's life there's
No.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: She closes the Doctor's eyes. There is a faint buzzing sound, then K'Anpo- Cho-Je appears, sitting cross-legged in midair.

Dialogue.Line: It's all right. He is not dead.
Oh no. I don't think I can take much more. CHO-JE: I am sorry to have startled you, my dear.
Won't you introduce me to your friend, Miss Smith?
Oh, er, yes. This is the Abbot of. No, it's Cho-Je. I mean, it looks like Cho-Je but it is really K'Anpo Rinpoche. I think.
Thank you. That makes everything quite clear. CHO-JE: The Doctor is alive.

No, you're wrong. He's dead. CHO-JE: All the cells of his body have been devastated by the Metebelis crystals, but you forget, he is a Time Lord. I will give the process a little push and the cells will regenerate. He will become a new man.
Literally? CHO-JE: Of course, he will look quite different.
Not again. CHO-JE: And it will shake up the brain cells a little. You may find his behaviour somewhat erratic.
When will all this happen? CHO-JE: Well there's no time like the present, is there.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cho-Je aims his fingers at the Doctor, then fades away.

Dialogue.Line: Goodbye. Look after him.
Now wait a moment.
Look, Brigadier. Look. I think it's starting.
Well, here we go again.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The silver wavy hair becomes brown wavy hair, and the face becomes younger. Number Four Doctor has arrived.
